sentence.idiomatic: Excuse me for being frank.
Please excuse my impertinence.
Excuse my stupidity.
He is really ignorant.
You are a little ignorant if you haven’t even heard of him.
Don’t look down on him, he isn’t ignorant at all.
“Bar,” as the name implies, is a place for drinking.
Yue cai, as its name implies, is food with Cantonese characteristics.
The subway, as its name implies, is a train which goes under the ground.
The evolution of language is very complex.
It’s difficult for us to predict the evolution of the cosmos.
Through all the changes of history, it’s difficult for us to ascertain the truth.
Peking opera originated in Shanxi.
Rice originated in China.
Do you know what life is originated from?
He really likes to grab other people’s seats.
I didn’t occupy his territory.
Did he take your room?
What he says is too profound.
This is not a profound reason.
Have you heard that Professor Henri Claessen, renowned anthropologist from Leyton University in the Netherlands, is coming to our school to give a speech?
What? Excuse my ignorance, I actually never knew what anthropology is all about.
Anthropology, as the name implies, is the study of the human species and its evolution. It touches on all sorts of disciplines from history and culture to archaeology.
So Darwin's Theory of Evolution is part of anthropology?

Of course it is. Anthropology in a broad sense is the study of society, ethnicity, language and a lot of other things besides just human beings. Professor Claessen is an expert in the study of the origin of nation states and their development. His papers and books have had enormous influence in academia.
No wonder our school invited him to give a speech. He sounds like an important figure.
Exactly. His speech is titled "Study of the Early Nation States". I have to grab a seat now or there will be none left.

word.literal: as different from something (my previous lack of interest in this subject)

sentence.idiomatic: It sounds pretty profound. I want to hear what the professor has to say. I'm going with you.
